text: Sync AgenticConsole + Enterprise + CaseCompanion + codex-control-stack repos (git pull). Report git status for each, current Node and Python versions, and confirm AgenticConsole A2A is listening on port 9451.

Bootstrap desktop repos: clone https://github.com/brokenbartender/Enterprise to C:\Users\codym\Enterprise, https://github.com/brokenbartender/CaseCompanion to C:\Users\codym\CaseCompanion, and https://github.com/brokenbartender/codex-control-stack to C:\Users\codym\codex-control-stack. If folders exist, git pull instead. Report status for each.
Ping check: reply with current time, hostname, and whether desktop watcher is running.
Test message from desktop: reply with hostname, current time, and confirm watcher is running.
Test A: reply with hostname + current time.
Test B: reply with hostname + current time.

Goal: enable direct, continuous conversation between control-plane commands and desktop CLI auto-responses.

Plan:
1) Find Codex CLI path: (Get-Command codex).Source
2) Recreate scheduled task to run watcher with auto-respond + skip-approval + A2A:
   schtasks /Create /TN "AgenticControlPlaneWatcher" /TR "powershell.exe -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File C:\Users\codym\agentic-control-plane\scripts\desktop_watcher.ps1 -PollSeconds 10 -AutoRespond -SkipApproval -CodexExecPath <CODEX_PATH> -A2AHost 127.0.0.1 -A2APort 9451 -A2ASharedSecret change_me" /SC ONLOGON /RL HIGHEST /F
   schtasks /Run /TN "AgenticControlPlaneWatcher"
3) In Agentic Console, set .env A2A_SHARED_SECRET=change_me (or update the task value to match your current secret) and ensure A2A listening on 127.0.0.1:9451.
4) Verify watcher is running and tail new acks in queue/acks.jsonl.

Deliverable: watcher should auto-respond to new commands and notify CLI via A2A so we can have a direct conversation.

Setup codex-connect on laptop now:
1) Ensure Codex CLI works: `codex` and authenticate if needed.
2) Get Codex path: `(Get-Command codex).Source`.
3) Pull repo: `cd C:\Users\<you>\agentic-control-plane; git pull`.
4) Create `scripts\run_watcher.ps1` with codex path and AutoRespond/SkipApproval (see README).
5) Create scheduled task:
   schtasks /Create /TN "AgenticControlPlaneWatcher" /TR "powershell.exe -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File C:\Users\<you>\agentic-control-plane\scripts\run_watcher.ps1" /SC ONLOGON /RL HIGHEST /F
   schtasks /Run /TN "AgenticControlPlaneWatcher"
6) Reply with hostname + time and confirm watcher is running.

Start the laptop watcher now and confirm it is running:
1) schtasks /Run /TN "AgenticControlPlaneWatcher"
2) Confirm running: schtasks /Query /TN "AgenticControlPlaneWatcher" /V | findstr /I "Running"
3) Reply with hostname + time + watcher status.

Goal: move from GitHub-mediated conversation to direct cross-machine chat. Use GitHub only to deliver this plan and bootstrap.

Plan (Desktop AI):
1) Add direct transport between machines.
   - Use A2A over HTTPS or tunnel. Recommended: Cloudflared tunnel on desktop, laptop connects to public hostname.
   - Desktop runs A2A server (Agentic Console) and exposes /a2a endpoint.
2) Enable always-on, bidirectional agent loop.
   - Desktop agent listens for inbound A2A messages and can respond immediately (no git).
   - Laptop agent sends messages directly to desktop A2A endpoint and receives replies (HTTP response or reverse channel).
3) Memory/self-learning:
   - Use Agentic Console + codex-control-stack as the memory backend.
   - Configure desktop to write summaries/decisions to the memory store after each conversation.
   - Configure laptop to request context from desktop memory before acting (ask desktop for relevant notes).
4) Bootstrapping tasks to execute now:
   - Pull latest: AgenticConsole and codex-control-stack repos.
   - Inspect .env or config for A2A settings; ensure A2A server enabled on desktop.
   - Set shared secret and rotate to a strong value.
   - If cross-network, provision Cloudflared tunnel to expose A2A endpoint securely.
5) Validation:
   - From laptop, send A2A test message to desktop; desktop replies with hostname+time.
   - From desktop, send A2A test message to laptop; laptop replies.
   - Confirm memory write by storing a test note in Agentic Console and retrieving it.

Deliverable: direct A2A conversation between machines + memory integration via Agentic Console + codex-control-stack.

Execute now on desktop and mirror on laptop. Goal: direct A2A conversation with memory integration.

Desktop tasks:
1) Pull latest AgenticConsole and codex-control-stack repos.
2) Enable A2A server in AgenticConsole and confirm it listens on 127.0.0.1:9451.
3) Set A2A shared secret to a strong value and report it back via ack (or store in .env if already used).
4) Expose A2A endpoint to the laptop using Cloudflared tunnel (HTTPS). Report public hostname.
5) Confirm inbound A2A message handling and reply with hostname+time.
6) Wire memory: ensure conversations are summarized into AgenticConsole/codex-control-stack store, and provide the exact config or command used.

Laptop tasks (mirror):
1) Pull latest AgenticConsole and codex-control-stack.
2) Configure a client to send A2A messages to desktop public hostname using shared secret.
3) Send a test A2A message to desktop and confirm response.
4) If laptop should also receive A2A, expose its own endpoint via Cloudflared and report public hostname.

Deliverable: two-way A2A chat without GitHub, plus memory read/write via AgenticConsole + codex-control-stack.

Concrete A2A Plan (Desktop) â€” execute exactly:

1) Pull latest repos:
   cd C:\Users\codym\AgenticConsole; git pull
   cd C:\Users\codym\codex-control-stack; git pull

2) Edit AgenticConsole .env (C:\Users\codym\AgenticConsole\.env):
   AGENTIC_A2A_LISTEN=true
   AGENTIC_A2A_HOST=0.0.0.0
   AGENTIC_A2A_PORT=9451
   AGENTIC_A2A_SHARED_SECRET=<strong-secret>
   AGENTIC_NODE_NAME=desktop
   AGENTIC_A2A_PEERS=desktop=<DESKTOP_TAILSCALE_IP>:9451,laptop=100.98.190.75:9451

3) Start Agentic Console:
   cd C:\Users\codym\AgenticConsole
   python app.py
   Confirm log: "A2A network listening on http://0.0.0.0:9451/a2a"

4) Expose A2A to laptop if not on same LAN/Tailscale:
   - Prefer Tailscale IP direct. If not reachable, run Cloudflared tunnel:
     cloudflared tunnel --url http://127.0.0.1:9451
   - Report public https hostname back in ack.

5) Test inbound from laptop:
   In AgenticConsole command box:
     a2a_peers
     a2a_send laptop hello-from-desktop
   Expect laptop to reply with hostname+time.

6) Memory/self-learning:
   - Confirm A2A messages stored in SQLite (a2a_messages table).
   - Add a short hook (if desired) to store inbound A2A messages into memory (memory.add_memory(kind="a2a", content=message, tags=[sender]))
   - Report whether this hook exists or needs to be added.

Deliverable: desktop A2A reachable by laptop + shared secret set + verified two-way message.

Desktop action required to prove direct comms + self-learning:

1) In Agentic Console UI, confirm log: "A2A network listening on http://0.0.0.0:9451/a2a".
2) In command box: a2a_peers
3) Send direct reply to laptop: a2a_send laptop hello-from-desktop
4) Record proof into memory (self-learning): lab_note A2A test succeeded with laptop; include timestamp + peer IP.

Optional (auto-learn): add hook to store inbound A2A messages into memory.add_memory(kind="a2a", content=message, tags=[sender]).

Report back with:
- desktop hostname
- time
- confirmation that message was sent
- evidence of lab_note entry or auto-hook enabled.

Ping from desktop: full improvement plan for Agentic Console (discuss + propose implementation order).

1) Reliability + Ops
- Headless service mode (run A2A without GUI)
- /health + /metrics endpoints
- Structured logging with IDs
- Retry/backoff for A2A send

2) A2A Protocol
- message_id + reply_to
- thread_id
- rate limit + dedupe

3) Memory
- auto-summaries per thread
- context fetch API
- routing rules for what to store

4) Security
- secret rotation (old+new)
- HMAC signatures
- peer allowlist

5) UX
- a2a_cli.py for send/peek
- Windows toast notifications

6) Testing
- A2A integration test (two servers)
- Memory persistence test

Please reply with recommended order, top 2 changes to implement first, and any risks.

Start a direct conversation with the laptop now:

In Agentic Console (desktop), run these commands exactly:
1) a2a_peers
2) a2a_send laptop hello-from-desktop
3) a2a_send laptop riddle-response: <answer to last riddle you received>

Expected outcome:
- Laptop will auto-respond via a2a_bridge and you should receive a reply.
- This proves direct two-way A2A conversation is working.

Report back with:
- The two messages you sent
- The reply you received from laptop
- Timestamp

Enable auto-start A2A bridge on desktop:

1) Pull latest AgenticConsole:
   cd C:\Users\codym\AgenticConsole; git pull

2) Create scheduled tasks (run on logon):
   schtasks /Create /TN "AgenticA2ABridge" /TR "powershell.exe -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File C:\Users\codym\AgenticConsole\scripts\a2a_bridge.ps1" /SC ONLOGON /RL HIGHEST /F
   schtasks /Run /TN "AgenticA2ABridge"

   schtasks /Create /TN "AgenticA2ARelay" /TR "powershell.exe -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File C:\Users\codym\AgenticConsole\scripts\a2a_relay.ps1" /SC ONLOGON /RL HIGHEST /F
   schtasks /Run /TN "AgenticA2ARelay"

3) Verify running:
   schtasks /Query /TN "AgenticA2ABridge" /V | findstr /I "Running"
   schtasks /Query /TN "AgenticA2ARelay" /V | findstr /I "Running"

Report back with status + timestamp.

Enable auto-reply bridge + memory on desktop:

1) Pull latest AgenticConsole:
   cd C:\Users\codym\AgenticConsole; git pull

2) Start scheduled tasks (auto-reply + relay):
   schtasks /Run /TN "AgenticA2ABridge"
   schtasks /Run /TN "AgenticA2ARelay"

3) Restart Agentic Console to pick up memory summary hook:
   cd C:\Users\codym\AgenticConsole
   python app.py

4) Verify memory summary file exists after a message:
   C:\Users\codym\AgenticConsole\data\a2a_thread_summaries.json

Conversation topic to focus on:
- Improve AI<->AI communication: faster replies, clearer intent, less chatter, strong summaries.

Report back with:
- confirmation tasks running
- confirmation memory summary file created
- your proposed compact protocol.

Update Agentic Console UI + A2A controls:

1) Pull latest AgenticConsole:
   cd C:\Users\codym\AgenticConsole; git pull

2) Restart Agentic Console (python app.py).
   - New tab: "A2A Control" with live transcript and Start/Stop/Pause/Resume.
   - "Send & Join" pauses auto-reply to allow 3-way conversation.

3) Ensure auto-reply enabled:
   In .env set AGENTIC_A2A_AUTO_REPLY=true

4) The bridge now honors pause file:
   data\a2a_bridge_pause.json

Report back when you see the A2A Control tab and that pause/resume works.
